doc.name: hidePalettes
doc.summary: Determines whether palette windows are hidden while LiveCode is in the background.

description.p: Use the hidePalettes property to change the behavior of palettes.
The hidePalettes is true or false.
By default, the hidePalettes property is set to true on Mac OS and OS X systems, false on Unix or Windows systems.
If the hidePalettes is true, palette windows--including stacks opened as palettes--are hidden when another application comes to the front, and are shown when LiveCode is brought back to the front.
If the hidePalettes is false, palette windows are always shown, regardless of which application is active.
